Description: Unique identifier for the transaction.
Unique identifier for the customer making the transaction.
Date and time when the transaction occurred, in ISO 8601 format with timezone.
Country from which the transaction was initiated.
Currency used by the sender for the transaction.
Currency received by the recipient.
Channel through which the transaction occurred (e.g., web, mobile, ATM).
Amount in the source currency.
Equivalent amount of the transaction in USD (using conversion rates).
The transaction fee charged.
Risk score associated with the IP address from which the transaction originated.
Know Your Customer (KYC) verification level (e.g., standard, enhanced).
Age of the customer's account, in days.
Trust score assigned to the device used for the transaction.
Number of chargebacks (disputes) associated with the customer's account.
Internal risk score based on the transaction and account data.
The velocity (rate) of transactions in the past 1 hour.
The velocity (rate) of transactions in the past 24 hours.
Risk score related to the corridor (the remittance channel between countries) for the transaction.
Flag indicating if the transaction was flagged as fraud (1 for fraud, 0 for non-fraud).
